greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of deficient divisors of n.
comment: Number of divisors d of n with sigma(d)<2*d (sigma = A000203).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Deficient Number.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} A294934(d) = A294926(n) + A294934(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 14 2017
example: All 4 divisors of n=21 are deficient: 1=A005100(1), 3=A005100(3), 7=A005100(6) and 21=A005100(17), therefore a(21)=4.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 07 2003
